definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: They built a crane capable of lifting 150 tons.
sentences.chinese: 他们造了一台能吊起150吨重量的吊车。

sentences.english: The container is winched off the ground.
Hang Teets with his own chain.
In smaller operations, the pig is hoisted for bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 小型屠宰场中，生猪都是被吊起放血。

sentences.english: We need a hoist to lift the concrete blocks.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一台起重机来吊起混凝土块。

sentences.english: The body is then raised either partially or completely from the ground by especially modified fishing hooks.
sentences.chinese: 人体被改造的特制鱼钩吊起，一部分或整体离开地面。

sentences.english: The machine can operate separately or cooperate with portal crane to hoist dirt.
sentences.chinese: 该机可单独运行，并可配合门机吊起工作。

sentences.english: The language angel  hanged up the gang and  banged them at the  angle of the  triangle.
sentences.chinese: 语文天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞。

sentences.english: He didn't hang himself, I hung him up to dry.
sentences.chinese: 他没有自杀，是我把他吊起来好让他晾干。

sentences.english: Help the perforating crew to hoist the pulley for perforating.
sentences.chinese: 协助炮队吊起射孔滑轮。

sentences.english: The language angel hanged up the gang and pushed them towards the outlook of the trioutlook.
sentences.chinese: 发言天使将那伙人吊起朝三角形的角上猛撞。

sentences.english: The helicopter winched the survivor up to safety.
sentences.chinese: 直升机把幸存者吊起送到安全的地方。

sentences.english: The stone was lifted by means of a rope and pulley .
sentences.chinese: 这块大石是用绳子和滑轮给吊起来的。

sentences.english: The practice of punishing people by hanging without due process of law .
sentences.chinese: 吊起来惩罚人的行为而没有法律的程序。

sentences.english: I know they're gonna hang me.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他们会把我吊起来。

sentences.english: All you've got to do is tie your head up.
sentences.chinese: 整个你想做的就是要把你的头吊起来。

definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
to hook onto/to hitch onto/to catch onto
rope tackle hanging from a mast/crow foot (system of ropes through tackle to hold up an awning)
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
